meanings.definition: The quality or state of being small in size or extent.
meanings.sent1: The littleness of the toy car made it easy to carry around.
meanings.sent2: The littleness of the pebble made it hard to notice among the rocks.
meanings.sent3: The littleness of the mouse made the elephant chuckle.
meanings.sent4: In the vast forest, the littleness of the firefly's light seemed like a tiny star.
meanings.sent5: The littleness of the ant compared to the elephant was astonishing.

meanings.definition: The condition of being insignificant or unimportant.
meanings.sent1: The littleness of the mistake did not affect the overall project.
meanings.sent2: The littleness of the decision seemed trivial in the grand scheme of things.
meanings.sent3: The littleness of the error caused a moment of laughter in the office.
meanings.sent4: In the story of the universe, the littleness of our planet is humbling.
meanings.sent5: The littleness of the problem was quickly forgotten amidst bigger challenges.
